frame.name: Cause_to_be_wet
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> causes a <fen>Patient</fen> to be wet with a <fen>Liquid</fen>. In this frame, the <fen>Liquid</fen> can be a liquid or gas. <fen>Patient</fen>s are porous objects, but not hollow (like containers). <ex><fex name="Agent">Jo</fex> <t>soaked</t> <fex name="Patient">the dog</fex> <fex name="Liquid">with water</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Ellen</fex> <t>wet</t> <fex name="Patient">the sponge</fex> <fex name="Liquid">with water</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is a volitional animate being who causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to become wet. <ex><fex name="Agt">Hannah</fex> <t>drenched</t> the cat with anti-flea ointment.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Liquid
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Liquid</fen> is a fluid or gas that permeates or covers the <fen>Patient</fen>. It most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with. <ex><fex name="Agent">Jo</fex> <t>soaked</t> <fex name="Patient">the dog</fex> <fex name="Liquid">with water</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Patient
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Patient</fen> takes up the <fen>Liquid</fen> through its pores or has the <fen>Liquid</fen> covering its surface. <ex>Ellen <t>wet</t> <fex name="Patient">the sponge</fex> with water.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> or way in which the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen> and what the <fen>Agent</fen> hopes to accomplish.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> with which an <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally wets the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>Colin <t>doused</t> the burning pot <fex name="Ins">with a fire extinguisher</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of wetness.
<ex><fex name="Cause">The sprinklers</fex> <t>drenched</t> me.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>Degree to which the <fen>Agent</fen> wets the <fen>Patient</fen>. <ex>Ryan <t>doused</t> the fire with water <fex name="Degr">until it stopped smoldering</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> describes which part of a larger whole is being affected.
<ex>The cloth was <t>wetted</t> <fex name="sub">around the edges</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the reason for the state of the Cause_to_be_wet event.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: wet.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cover or touch with liquid

lexUnit.name: saturate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: soak thoroughly with water or other liquid.

lexUnit.name: souse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: soak in or drench with liquid

lexUnit.name: moisten.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to become slightly wet

lexUnit.name: humidify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: increase the level of moisture in (air)

lexUnit.name: hydrate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to absorb or combine with water.

lexUnit.name: moisturize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make (something, especially the skin) less dry.
